chapterSummary.General: Numbers 8 describes the consecration of the Levites and the lighting of the lamps, emphasizing the importance of purity and dedication in service to God.
chapterSummary.Non-Denominational: This chapter highlights the importance of purity and dedication in service to God.
chapterSummary.Baptist: The chapter emphasizes the importance of purity and dedication in God's work.
chapterSummary.Catholic: Numbers 8 illustrates the Church's understanding of purity and dedication in service.
chapterSummary.Methodist: This chapter shows the importance of purity and dedication in the community.
chapterSummary.Lutheran: The chapter demonstrates God's order and the importance of purity and dedication.
chapterSummary.Presbyterian: This chapter reflects God's covenant faithfulness and the importance of purity and dedication.
chapterSummary.Pentecostal: Numbers 8 shows the importance of spiritual dedication and purity in God's kingdom.
chapterSummary.Anglican: The chapter demonstrates the importance of purity and dedication in the Church.
chapterSummary.Orthodox: This chapter reveals the sacred nature of purity and dedication.

2.General: Speak to Aaron and say to him, 'When you set up the lamps, see that all seven light up the area in front of the lampstand.'

3.General: Aaron did so; he set up the lamps so that they faced forward on the lampstand, just as the Lord commanded Moses.
